title: Paul Flores sentenced to 25 years to life for murder of Kristin Smart
description: Paul Flores was sentenced to 25 years to life in prison for the murder of Kristin Smart on Friday. He is not eligible for probation.

title: Oregon courthouse security video shows escaping defendant
description: Newly released video in Oregon shows a defendant escaping from a courthouse seconds after sheriff’s deputies remove his shackles

title: Podcaster, husband fatally shot by stalker who broke into home: Police
description: A stalker broke a podcaster's home and shot and killed her and her husband before killing himself. The podcaster had a no-contact order against him.

title: Woman allegedly held captive in locked trailer for 4 years
description: A Houston man has been charged with kidnapping for allegedly holding a woman captive in a locked Houston trailer for several years, court records show.

title: Survivor of White Rose group that resisted Nazis dies at 103
description: The last known survivor of a German group known as the White Rose that actively resisted the Nazis has died

title: 9th grader sues over Pledge of Allegiance confrontation
description: The parents of a South Carolina high school student are suing a teacher, principal, and other education officials saying she was accosted when she didn't stop and recite the Pledge of Allegiance

title: 1st nasal spray treatment of its kind for migraines gets FDA approval
description: The FDA approved Pfizer's newest drug on the migraine market, Zavzpret (zavegepant), the first and only migraine treatment offered in a nasal spray.

title: Wife sues over meteorologist's death in NC helicopter crash
description: The family of a meteorologist who was killed in a helicopter crash in North Carolina is suing a maintenance facility and the company that owned and operated the aircraft

title: West slammed with more snow and rain, threatening flooding
description: More than 70 million people across 23 states are under severe weather alerts as multiple storms move across country.

title: Silicon Valley Bank seized as depositors pull cash
description: This marks the largest bank failure since the 2008 financial crisis.

title: House votes to declassify info about origins of COVID-19
description: The House has voted unanimously to declassify U.S. intelligence information about the origins of COVID-19

title: Men found guilty in Ahmaud Arbery case file appeals for hate crime convictions
description: Gregory McMichael, Travis McMichael and William Bryan filed appeals against their hate crime convictions.

title: Michigan State shooter's note says he felt hated, rejected
description: A man who fatally shot three students and wounded five others on the Michigan State University campus left a note describing himself as being “hated,” “a loner” and an “outcast.”

title: What Norfolk Southern's CEO did and didn't commit to during his Senate grilling
description: Shaw declined to directly answer what Norfolk Southern would specifically do for affected families in Thursday's congressional testimony.

title: 4 people miraculously survive after medical helicopter crash
description: Four people are alive after a medical helicopter that was transporting a patient crashed in Macon County, North Carolina, on Thursday evening.

title: Fire breaks out at building near White House, no injuries
description: There's been a fire at the Eisenhower Executive Office Building next to the White House, leading to the evacuation of workers as firefighters responded to the call

title: Berlin to let everyone go topless at public swimming pools
description: Women in Berlin will soon be allowed to go topless, like men, at the city’s public pools

title: 82-year-old charged with sale of fake Michael Jordan cards
description: An 82-year-old Colorado man has been charged with selling and trading fake Michael Jordan basketball cards

title: US adds a robust 311,000 jobs despite Fed's rate hikes
description: America’s employers added a substantial 311,000 jobs in February, fewer than January’s huge gain but easily enough to keep pressure on the Federal Reserve to raise interest rates aggressively to fight inflation

title: 'Cocaine cat' escaped owner, will now live at Cincinnati Zoo
description: The Cincinnati Zoo has taken in an African serval cat after the animal was recovered from a wild adventure

title: Iran, Saudi Arabia agree to resume relations after tensions
description: Iran and Saudi Arabia have agreed to reestablish diplomatic relations and reopen embassies after years of tensions

title: Mikaela Shiffrin gets her record 86th World Cup victory
description: Mikaela Shiffrin has won her record-tying 86th World Cup race.

title: BP CEO pay doubles to $12M as high energy costs surge profit
description: Total pay for BP’s CEO more than doubled to $12 million last year

title: UK has new Duke of Edinburgh as king gives his brother title
description: Britain’s King Charles III has made his youngest brother the Duke of Edinburgh, passing on a title held by their late father, Prince Philip

title: China accuses Canada of smearing over secret police stations
description: China has accused Canada of smearing its reputation over allegations China is secretly operating two overseas Chinese police stations in Quebec

title: Defective, loose wheels risking derailment discovered on Norfolk Southern rail cars
description: A series of rail cars that Norfolk Southern recently put into service have been discovered to have defective, loose wheels.

title: Sexual assault reports increase at US military academies
description: Reported sexual assaults at the U.S. military academies shot up during the 2021-22 school year

title: Georgia drops foreign agents law after massive protests
description: Georgian lawmakers have voted to drop a controversial bill that opponents — and thousands of protesters gathered in the capital — warned could stifle dissent and curtail media freedoms

title: Schools shut, drivers stuck as gales and blizzards batter UK
description: Trains have been canceled, schools shut and drivers stuck for hours as a blast of snow and wind hits Britain for the second time in a week

title: Is inflation still surging? Jobs report will provide clues
description: A month ago, the government dropped a bombshell jobs report that showed that America’s employers added a sizzling half-million-plus positions in January — twice the December gain and far more than economists had expected

title: Car crashes through North Carolina airport terminal after driving onto tarmac
description: A car has crashed through the terminal of Wilmington International Airport after driving through a fence and onto the airport's tarmac on Thursday night.

title: Theranos exec Sunny Balwani loses bid to delay prison term
description: A federal judge has rejected former Theranos executive Ramesh “Sunny” Balwani’s bid to remain free while he appeals his conviction for crimes he committed during a blood-testing scam he orchestrated with his former boss and lover, Elizabeth Holmes

title: Railroad group warns that car flaw could cause derailments
description: U.S. railroads were warned to take certain cars out of service Thursday after Norfolk Southern discovered loose wheels on a car involved in last weekend’s derailment in Ohio

title: 'Baretta' actor Robert Blake dies at 89, niece says
description: Actor Robert Blake has died at 89 from heart disease, his niece confirmed.

title: Some models of Safety 1st and Maxi-Cosi car seats recalled
description: Dorel Juvenile Group announced a recall of nearly 60,000 car seats due to concerns over the seat anchoring system in some models, according to the company.

title: Residents say state isn't fixing wastewater lines, advocacy groups allege racial bias
description: Currently, at least 30,000 homes have failing systems in the Black Belt region.

title: DA invites Trump to testify in grand jury probe of Stormy Daniels payoff: Sources
description: The Manhattan DA has informed former President Trump of his right to testify before a grand jury probing his role in a 2016 payment to Stormy Daniels, sources say.

title: DA refutes claims that 'Rust' gun was destroyed
description: Prosecutors in the "Rust" criminal case refuted claims by the defense that the weapon involved in the case was destroyed.
